metadata.title: CVE-2024-26964 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: usb:xhci: Add error handling in xhci_map_urb_for_dma Currentlyxhci_map_urb_for_dma() creates a temporary buffer and copies the SG list tothe new linear buffer. But if the kzalloc_node() fails, then the followingsg_pcopy_to_buffer() can lead to crash since it tries to memcpy to NULLpointer. So return -ENOMEM if kzalloc returns null pointer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26964` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
